intro: Lobelia holstii f. minor, commonly known as the dwarf lobelia, is a compact, low-growing perennial native to South America. It features small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. The plant has hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its native arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact size and vibrant floral display.
